faq.question: What is MCP and why should I use it?
faq.answer: MCP (Model Context Protocol) enables AI assistants to use tools and access external data. It provides a standardized way for LLMs to interact with APIs, databases, and services.

faq.question: Which programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: This guide covers both Python (using FastMCP) and TypeScript/JavaScript (using the MCP TypeScript SDK) implementations.

faq.question: How do I test my MCP server?
faq.answer: Use the included evaluation framework to create test questions and verify your tools work correctly. The framework runs your server against Claude with realistic scenarios.

faq.question: What transport mechanisms are available?
faq.answer: MCP supports stdio (for local/CLI tools), HTTP (for web services), and Server-Sent Events (for real-time updates). Choose based on your deployment needs.

faq.question: How do I handle authentication?
faq.answer: The guide includes OAuth 2.1 and API key authentication patterns. Store credentials in environment variables and validate tokens before processing requests.

faq.question: Can I use this with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes! MCP servers work with Claude Code, Claude Desktop, and any MCP-compatible client. The servers you build will be available as tools in these applications.
